channel.title: Outreachy on Aishwarya Pant
channel.description: Recent content in Outreachy on Aishwarya Pant

item.title: outreachy : closing notes
item.description: This is the last week of my three-month internship with Outreachy. Did I accomplish what I had set out to do? In some ways, yes. I have written a helper tool that tries to generate and formats sysfs style documentation. Link to the project - attribute documentation. As I mentioned in a previous post, the ABI documentation format looks like the following: What: (the full sysfs path of the attribute)

item.title: attribute documentation : what, why, how?
item.description: Before I talk about the title of the post, I will take a diversion to try to explain what kernel hackers mean when they say they do not break userspace. What is an API and an ABI? API: Application Programming Interface ABI: Application Binary Interface The two terms are closely related and can be a source of confusion. Both APIs and ABIs specify how two components interact with each other.

item.title: You should apply for Outreachy!
item.description: For the last three weeks, I’ve been working as an Outreachy intern with Linux Kernel. Outreachy is an amazing three-month internship programme to get more underrepresented people to work on Free & Open Source Software (FOSS). It was started because of very low participation of women (less than 8%) in Google Summer of Code (GSoC). It’s completely remote and interns are paid $5,500 on completion of the project with an additional $500 stipend for attending conferences or meet-ups.
